content:
select Page

Posted by Andrew Burnside  Nov    Featured Sports  

The Emory womens soccer team played a fantastic game Tuesday when they tied Division I Kennesaw State University  in double overtime PERIOD

Sophomore midfielder Melissa Ardizzone scored early in the first half to give the Eagles their only goal PERIOD The goal was Ardizzones career first as well as the first Eagle goal in six games PERIOD

The Eagles held Kennesaw State scoreless almost the entire game PERIOD The Owls managed a point when freshman midfielder Jackie Grey scored a goal for them PERIOD Senior goalkeeper Liz Arnold who almost blocked the shot played one of the most impressive games of her career tying her career high with eight saves PERIOD

The Owls seemed to outplay the Eagles during regulation shooting  to the Eagles nine PERIOD However Emory improved in overtime by outshooting Kennesaw State  with a  margin in shots on goal PERIOD

The young Eagles have been struggling in recent games PERIOD After starting out the season  Emory has not had a win in the past six games including four divisional games PERIOD

Now with an impressive tie behind them the team is looking to get back on track PERIOD Emory now faces three straight University Athletic Association UAA schools at home to close out the  regular season PERIOD The Eagles will play Brandeis University Mass. on Friday evening at  p.m PERIOD and then match up against New York University Sunday morning PERIOD
